item.title: Not reinstated rubbish in soil, 15th February
item.description:
This area should be reinstated green land, instead its littered with plastic, broken bricks and general rubbish from a building site This should not be left in this poor condition Has this area been adopted or n still under development control

item.title: Multiple areas of broken road surface with material becoming detached from base surface,, 15th February
item.description:
The problem starts at the entry of the road and continues along its whole length with various areas of broken and detached tarmac. The problem is becoming worse by the day with traffic, The pavement condition is also atrocious in this road, as reported in separate report entry.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Branch Hill Rise, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sinkhole outside number 17 is still sinking and has NOt been fixed even though you have said it is. It’s a dangerous dip in the road and I can’t see why you have said it’s been fixed, 15th February
item.description:
Hewlett Road . Number 17
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50;52, All Saints' Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Example of badly uneven and dangerous pavements in Branch Hill Rise, with both broken and uneven surfaces, dropped metal utility covers etc, the pavements in the road are in dreadful condition and a danger to pedestrians., 15th February
item.description:
This particular problem is outside number 17 but the pavement surfaces in this street are all in very poor and uncared for condition. There has been no remedial action in this street for years if not decades,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Branch Hill Rise, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
